posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.67 beta soon.

If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Using Obtanium? Remember to opt-in for pre-release tags to receive beta updates.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

  • Optimize add to groups screen for large screen devices.
  • System camera QR scans route into Signal camera for account restoration.
  • Fix message reactions positioning in right-to-left languages.
  • Fix WiFi detection when using VPNs.

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.66 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.67.0 (162600)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

50 new commits since 7.66.5:

Show commits

  • Optimize more during low disk situations. [1]

  • Add split pane UI for add to groups screen. [2]

  • Simplify redundant split-pane window size class checks. [3]

  • Prevent soft keyboard from covering recipient picker floating action button. [4]

  • Enable split pane UI for add to groups screen. [5]

  • Set proper tier when writing to storage service. [6]

  • Update to latest backup tests. [7]

  • Route system camera quick restore qr scan into Signal camera. [8]

  • Patch bug rendering PAC file users unable to connect. [9]

  • Address design feedback for calling UI. [10]

  • Add support for displaying spoiler text in compose. [11]

  • Update compileSdk to 36. [12]

  • Add basic pinned message support. [13]

  • Fix position of message reaction overlay in RTL. [14]

  • Enforce correct permissions when pinning messages. [15]

  • Add call summary support for all calls. [16]

  • Improve the pinned messages bottom sheet. [17]

  • Fix recipient search bar configuration for add to groups screen. [18]

  • Add initial registration v5 prototype. [19]

  • Add Mi 9T Pro to the voice note sample rate special handling. [20]

    Fixes #14452

  • Convert SignalProxyUtil from Java to Kotlin. [21]

    Resolves #14453

  • Handle network errors gracefully during contacts refresh on new message and new call screens. [22]

  • Add go to indicator for pinned messages. [23]

  • Add various fixes for pinned messages. [24]

  • Call quality survey integration. [25]

  • Fix emoji sizing on call reaction bar. [26]

  • Prevent call video from being turned off in multiwindow. [27]

  • Display existing group members in alphabetical order on add to groups screen. [28]

  • Do not allow outgoing messages when backing up release notes. [29]

  • Publish Kotlin class outputs as SourceSet outputs for jdt.ls [30]

    • Resolves Java <-> Kotlin in VSCode
    • Add build/classes/kotlin/{main,test} as SourceSet outputs (builtBy compileKotlin/compileTestKotlin)
    • Improves VSCode Java (jdt.ls via Buildship) classpath so Java can resolve Kotlin symbols in same module
    • Metadata-only; no change to packaging or runtime
      Resolves #14355

  • Add support extension for isInMultiWindowMode check. [31]

  • Only proceed with completion check if the id matches. [32]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.60.3 [33]

  • Fix IndexOutOfBounds crash in ComposeText.onMeasure [34]

  • Support pinning of edited messages. [35]

  • Fix dark theme color for pinned messages. [36]

  • Small UI fixes for pinned messages. [37]

  • Add proper animation for call quality sheet. [38]

  • Fix keyboard animation when going back from emoji-search. [39]

  • Throw a retry error if we get an execution error while processing one-time donations. [40]

  • Fix banner color with wallpapers. [41]

  • Fix divider color. [42]

  • Upgrade compose bom to 2025.11.01 [43]

  • Always show pip in call. [44]

  • Introduce core-models module. [45]

    Needed to share some key components with feature modules without having
    to depend on libsignal-service.

  • Guard against invalid attachment states when copying to archive. [46]

    Fixes #14461

  • Improve wifi detection to account for VPNs. [47]

    Fixes #14462

  • fixup! Fix bug in job eligibility sorting after a job deletion. [48]

  • Update translations and other static files. [49]

  • Bump version to 7.67.0 [50]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.66.5…v7.67.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

Add basic pinned message support. [13]

Nice!

I wonder what this looks like.

updates-bot:

Add go to indicator for pinned messages. [23]

Relevant feature requests:

https://community.signalusers.org/t/bookmarks-favorites-starred-pinned-messages/6004/93

Pin a message to top of chat Feature Requests
Your Signal clients do not synchronize chats with a server the way Discord, Slack, Teams, or Matrix does. If pinned messages comes to Signal, each person would need to pin the same message. The messages reside on individual devices. Each person can delete the message from the device, so there is no way to have a common pinned message for everyone in the chat. New members would not see a previously sent message, thus could not pin it. I think that this is a good idea and should become its own f…

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat

posts.cooked:
dishes8:

I don’t know if I should keep reporting backup issues here or on github, but backups have still not worked for me with the same error from previous post.

Thanks, that’s helpful information - we’ll look into it!

No need to continue reporting this same issue until after we’ve published another fix. We’re tracking that bug internally. It’s good to hear that you found a successful workaround in the meantime though

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Failure to receive the “missed call” log in Desktop even though I had received the call in other client:

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.82.0-beta.1/eb3ae80697c98aecc6603bcce7e11c57f15ca74fdc750029684151af147f8213.gz

1. The text input box is obscured by the navigation bar.
A bug report already exists for this, but it has been closed.

github.com/signalapp/signal-android

Lower navigation bar interferes with message text box

opened 12:10PM - 19 Nov 25 UTC
closed 02:26PM - 21 Nov 25 UTC
jwoithe

### Guidelines - [x] I have searched searched open and closed issues for duplic…ates - [x] I am submitting a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended - [x] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic ### Bug description Following an update to Signal 7.65.3, the lower navigation bar of Android interferes with the text input control in a conversation. Signal 7.64.2 on the same phone is fine. The phone is a Nokia 6.1 running Android 10. The symptoms appear identical to those described in [issue 14410](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/issues/14410), although that issue was from 2 weeks ago and was fixed in version 7.64.1. It therefore predates the problem that emerged today. A [reddit post from two days ago](https://www.reddit.com/r/signal/comments/1ozipwa/cant_type_message_anymore/) is another example of the symptoms I'm seeing. The first screenshot in this reddit thread matches what I see. The problem can be worked around by long tapping on the last message in a conversation, then tapping in the greyed out area. After this the text input is in its correct location (above the bottom navigation bar) and can be used normally until sending the message or selecting a new conversation. I notice two commits made 2 days ago, which (given the timing) *may* have been made in response to the reddit post mentioned above and be implicated: commit 9798a11 and commit b316c6f. Both reference the bottom bar in their commit message. Furthermore, both commits made it into 7.65.3 which exhibits the problem for me. Could it be that these commits fixed a problem for one set of users and created one for others? A quick look through commits back to Signal 7.64.2 didn't show any other commits which are obviously related to the problem at hand. Let me know if you need more information or want me to try something. ### Screenshots _No response_ ### Device Nokia 6.1 ### Android version 10 ### Signal version 7.65.3 ### Link to debug log _No response_

2. When you exit a chat using the back button, Signal closes completely.

Debug log for both issues:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.67.0/b9e941e9a5e736924d3664e03f1d29339c7feb1c3d27bda6d178aa71eb453d7a

link_counts.title: Lower navigation bar interferes with message text box · Issue #14431 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
In my Samsung Galaxy S24, probably happens in other phones too, I’m observing the following behavior:

Ensure you have the navigation buttons enabled and not the navigation gestures.

  1. Open the app
  2. Go into a chat
  3. Press and maintain pressed the go back navigation button
  4. Observe how the chat screen goes into the background, and at the same time you can also see the chat list (welcome screen). Both screens appear, similar to how it would show up if you pressed the show open apps navigation button.

This doesn’t happen with other screens and I suspect it is the same underlying cause of the bug I reported before:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.65 release Android Beta Feedback
I’m observing a recent behavior that is visually annoying when quickly exiting conversations: Open the app Go into any conversation Tap as fast as you can the back navigation key. If you are using hand gestures to go back it might not be fast enough as tapping. Try using the three navigation buttons Android used to have. The app must’ve closed Open the app again. Observe that for a noticeable period of time the conversation that you closed before appears transparently overlaid over the convers…

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.65 release

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
Is it the expected behavior that an audio message gets paused if I’m going to react to it while listening?

If yes, could this be changed? If one is listening to an audio message in loudspeaker, why would I want the audio to stop playing just because I’m about to react to the audio message?

hans84:

The text input box is obscured by the navigation bar.

Tracking - does this happen to you every time you use that screen or only during certain circumstances?

hans84:

When you exit a chat using the back button, Signal closes completely.

I wasn’t able to reproduce this issue. Could you provide some additional details or maybe a video?

AlertSubject:

predictive back gesture has a white border around the edge of the screen when you back out of a chat

Yeah I see that, thanks for the bug report!

sigfun:

his doesn’t happen with other screens and I suspect it is the same underlying cause of the bug I reported before:

Thanks, this issue is still on our radar.

sigfun:

Is it the expected behavior that an audio message gets paused if I’m going to react to it while listening?

That shouldn’t happen. We’ll look into it!

jeffrey-signal:

Tracking - does this happen to you every time you use that screen or only during certain circumstances?

It happens pretty much every time, sometimes the text input box is over the navigation bar. Then, for example, if you open the contact’s profile page and go back, the text input box is covered by the navigation bar again.

Signal only closes completely, when the navigation bar covers the text input box.
Otherwise, when exiting a chat, Signal returns to the chat list.

Video

posts.name: Golden Dragonfly
posts.cooked:
During my last call—both outgoing and incoming—the caller could hear me clearly, but I couldn’t hear their audio. I tried multiple times and got the same result each time. In regular phone calls or calls made through other apps, I can hear perfectly fine. This issue only happens with Signal, and I’ve encountered it several times before.

Debug Link

A sticker I sent a few hours ago has disappeared from the conversation.

10000167971440×1435 59.4 KB

Also noticed that tap input is completely disabled when the screen privacy toast message is active.

posts.name: Michelle

GoldenDragonfly:

During my last call—both outgoing and incoming—the caller could hear me clearly, but I couldn’t hear their audio.

Interestingly, your logs say we don’t have permissions. Could you double check that and if this happens again, could you also include the debug logs of the person who is calling you?

Avitus:

A sticker I sent a few hours ago has disappeared from the conversation.

Strange. Does it happen every time you send that specific sticker?

I’m not sure if this is a Signal issue, or a Gboard issue. When typing in Signal, the keyboard seems to miss key presses, almost like it is crashing every 3-4 seconds. Only seems to happen in Signal as far as I can tell.

Pixel 9 Pro Fold, Android 16 QPR2
